Executive Summary

We are pleased to submit our proposal in response to your RFP for a next-generation financial reconciliation and ledger solution.
reviews.reason_text: It is a proposal response to an RFP and does not state specific requirements.

reviews.text: Our platform is purpose-built to deliver real-time accuracy, auditability, and operational resilience, leveraging a scalable technical foundation and an AI-driven reconciliation engine.
reviews.reason_text: States enforceable system behavior (real-time accuracy, auditability, operational resilience).

reviews.text: Our mission is to empower your organization with transparent, compliant, and automated financial operations, supporting sustainable growth and regulatory readiness.
reviews.reason_text: It is a mission statement and does not state specific requirements.

reviews.text: With extensive experience in financial systems, cloud-native infrastructure, and secure data management, we are confident in our ability to exceed your performance, compliance, and service expectations.
reviews.reason_text: Confidence in performance and compliance without specific requirements.

reviews.text:
Compliance & Certifications

SOC 2 Type II
reviews.reason_text: SOC 2 Type II certification is a specific compliance requirement.

reviews.text:
Compliance

Our platform is audited annually under the American Institute of CPAs’ (AICPA) SOC 2 Type II standards, covering the Trust Services Criteria of security, availability, processing integrity, confidentiality, and privacy.
reviews.reason_text: Annual audits under SOC 2 enforce compliance.

reviews.text: Our 2025 audit scope includes all production systems, client data flows, access controls, change management processes, and incident response mechanisms.
reviews.reason_text: Details audit scope but does not enforce behavior directly.

reviews.text:
ISO 27001 Certification

We maintain full ISO 27001 certification across our infrastructure, policies, and procedures, certified by an accredited third-party auditor.
reviews.reason_text: ISO 27001 certification is a specific security requirement.

reviews.text: Our ISO 27001 scope encompasses cloud hosting environments, physical office security, endpoint management, and data governance.
reviews.reason_text: Details ISO 27001 scope but does not enforce behavior directly.

reviews.text:
Audit Cadence

We undergo independent external audits on the following cadence:
	•	SOC 2 Type II: Annually
	•	ISO 27001 Surveillance: Annually
	•	ISO 27001 Recertification: Every three years
Internal control self-assessments are conducted quarterly, supplemented by semi-annual penetration tests performed by CREST-certified vendors.
reviews.reason_text: Details audit cadence but does not enforce behavior directly.

reviews.text:
Technical Architecture

Real-Time Ledger Design

Our ledger engine is optimized for high-throughput, low-latency transaction ingestion.
reviews.reason_text: Enforces high throughput and low latency in ledger engine.

reviews.text:
Key features include:
	•	Double-entry accounting model ensuring atomicity and immutability.
reviews.reason_text: Double-entry accounting ensures atomicity and immutability.

reviews.text: •	Partitioned transaction journals for scalability and isolation across clients.
reviews.reason_text: Partitioned transaction journals ensure scalability and isolation.

reviews.text: •	Multi-version concurrency control (MVCC) to enable parallel reads and writes without locks.
reviews.reason_text: Multi-version concurrency control enables parallel reads and writes.

reviews.text: Ledger data is persisted to a cloud-native relational database with strong ACID guarantees.
reviews.reason_text: Cloud-native database with ACID guarantees enforces data persistence.

reviews.text:
Failover Clusters

The system operates in an active-active cluster model across two distinct cloud availability zones per region, with automatic failover triggered within 30 seconds upon detection of node or zone failures.
reviews.reason_text: Failover clusters with automatic failover trigger failures.

reviews.text:
Disaster Recovery (DR) readiness is ensured via:
	•	Hourly snapshots of ledger state.
reviews.reason_text: Hourly snapshots ensure disaster recovery via data governance.

reviews.text: •	Warm standby region maintained at 80% capacity, located geographically distant from the primary region.
reviews.reason_text: Details warm standby region but does not enforce behavior directly.

reviews.text:
Data Retention Policies

Transaction data, audit trails, and reconciliation records are retained for a minimum of 7 years, configurable up to 10 years based on client-specific compliance requirements.
reviews.reason_text: Data retention policies enforce specific periods based on compliance.

reviews.text: Data is encrypted at rest with AES-256 and in transit using TLS 1.3.
reviews.reason_text: Data encryption with AES-256 and TLS 1.3 ensures security.

reviews.text: End-of-retention deletions follow GDPR and CCPA-compliant workflows, including secure erasure verification logs.
reviews.reason_text: Specifies enforceable deletion behavior after retention period.

reviews.text:
AI Reconciliation Engine

Data Model

The reconciliation engine ingests structured financial events into a normalized data schema encompassing transactional metadata, entity identifiers, reference fields, and reconciliation status.
reviews.reason_text: Describes system architecture without enforceable behavior.

reviews.text:
The model supports:
	•	Multi-ledger reconciliation (e.g., payment processor vs. bank settlement ledger).
reviews.reason_text: Imposes the requirement to support multi-ledger reconciliation.

reviews.text: •	Hierarchical mapping for nested transactions (e.g., payouts containing sub-transactions).
reviews.reason_text: Imposes hierarchical mapping requirement for nested transactions.

reviews.text: •	Custom reconciliation rules definable per client.
reviews.reason_text: Imposes custom rule capability per client.

reviews.text:
Reconciliation SLA
	•	Match Rate: ≥ 99.5% within 4 hours of transaction ingestion.
reviews.reason_text: Sets match rate SLA as enforceable behavior.

reviews.text: •	Discrepancy Resolution SLA: Flagging and auto-triage within 15 minutes of mismatch detection.
reviews.reason_text: Sets resolution time SLA as enforceable behavior.

reviews.text: Anomaly Detection
reviews.reason_text: Imposes anomaly detection requirement.

reviews.text:
The AI engine utilizes:
	•	Time-series forecasting models to predict expected volume and value trends.
reviews.reason_text: Describes AI engine components without enforceable behavior.

reviews.text: •	Unsupervised clustering to detect novel transaction patterns indicative of fraud, operational errors, or reconciliation drift.
reviews.reason_text: Imposes clustering usage but not enforceable without constraints.

reviews.text: Anomalies are scored based on confidence thresholds and escalated via automated alerts and ticket generation.
reviews.reason_text: Imposes anomaly scoring as enforceable behavior.

reviews.text:
Implementation Plan

Phase 1 – Discovery & Design (Weeks 1–4)
	•	Requirements workshops
	•	System design specification finalization
	•	Integration planning with existing systems

Phase 2 – Core System Setup (Weeks 5–8)
	•	Cloud environment provisioning
	•	Ledger engine and reconciliation modules deployment
	•	Connectivity to external data sources and APIs

Phase 3 – Validation & Testing (Weeks 9–11)
	•	Ledger validation using synthetic transaction sets
	•	Reconciliation engine pilot with historical data
	•	UAT execution with client stakeholders

Phase 4 – Cutover & Launch (Week 12)
	•	Cutover dry-run exercises
	•	Production cutover to live systems
	•	Hypercare support activation

Resources
	•	Project Manager (full time)
	•	Lead Solution Architect (part time)
	•	Two Backend Engineers (full time)
	•	QA Specialist (full time)
	•	Client Success Manager (part time)

Pricing Model

Licensing

A base platform license of $6,000 per month covers access to the ledger system, reconciliation engine, and reporting modules.
reviews.reason_text: Details implementation plan without enforceable requirements.

reviews.text:
License includes up to 5 million monthly transactions.

Per-Transaction Fees
	•	Transactions exceeding 5 million/month incur an additional $0.0012 per transaction.
reviews.reason_text: Imposes per-transaction fee as enforceable behavior.

reviews.text: •	Anomalous transaction reviews beyond SLA thresholds (client-requested investigations) incur $0.50 per item.
reviews.reason_text: Imposes penalty for exceeding transaction limits as enforceable.
